lead_paragraph: After 12 days of the Salt Lake Olympics, judging irregularities in figure skating have caused a greater stir than security threats. A senior official with the Utah Olympic Public Safety Command said today that security plans and operations that could end up costing the federal government more than $400 million have worked to near perfection and that no incident of any consequence has threatened any Olympic sites or competitions.

headline.main: Safeguarding the Games Is Costly but Effective
